title: Trump's unchecked imperialism raises growing concerns
subhed: While the Trump administration's handling of the Venezuelan situation has revealed numerous contradictions, its intentions regarding Greenland have sparked anxiety and opposition among members of Congress, including Republicans.
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: In Paris, Ukraine's allies express hopes and fears over US security guarantees
subhed: The coalition of the willing, a group of Kyiv's allies who met in Paris on Tuesday, said they were ready to send troops to Ukraine for a ceasefire if they were guaranteed that the US would deter any new Russian attack.
byline: By Claire Gatinois and Philippe Ricard

title: Trump weighs 'range of options' for acquiring Greenland, including military ones
subhed: Donald Trump is looking at ideas for acquiring the Danish territory and using the US military is 'always an option,' the White House said on Tuesday. Earlier, Greenland and Denmark called for a meeting with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio after Trump's renewed claims.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Roberto Saviano, writer: 'Venezuela is not a narco-state, but a state that uses drugs as an instrument for the survival of those in power'
subhed: Western democracies have allowed the regime to survive, enabling it to strengthen itself by becoming increasingly criminalized. Today, Venezuela acts as a hub state, exhibiting advanced forms of narco-structuring, writes the author of 'Gomorrah.'

title: Venezuela, under state of emergency, stages illusory transition
subhed: A decree granting emergency powers to the head of state has left Venezuelans on the ground anxious, as the US moves to capture oil and political influence.
byline: By Elisabeth Miranda and Angeline Montoya

title: Brigitte Bardot to be buried in Saint-Tropez as cause of death revealed
UN accuses Israel of 'apartheid' in the West Bank
Paris snow forces 140 flight cancellations
Saudi-led coalition strikes Yemen as separatist leader flees
Iran risks losing a key economic and military ally in Venezuela
byline: By Ghazal Golshiri and Madjid Zerrouky

title: After tragedy at Swiss resort bar, residents express 'anger' and 'shame'

title: AFCON 2025: Algeria reaches quarterfinals, Côte d'Ivoire also advances
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Cold snap hits Paris's homeless population hard
Ukraine's Western allies agree on key security guarantees in Paris

byline: By Sandrine Cassini, Mariama Darame, Corentin Lesueur and Alexandre Pedro

title: Deep freeze grips Europe, killing six and disrupting travel
Reviving Venezuela's oil industry comes at a steep cost
EU offers extra funds to quell farmer anger over Mercosur trade deal
With the Venezuela operation, Marco Rubio is at the heart of reshaping the 'Western Hemisphere'
'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
subhed: Donald Trump's military operation in Venezuela should show Europeans that the US is a predator for Europe, just like Russia and China, argues former United Nations under-secretary-general Jean-Marie Guéhenno.

title: Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
subhed: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

title: 'Trump is torn between the UAE and Saudi Arabia'
subhed: US President Donald Trump faces pressure from Mohammed bin Salman to oppose the separatist strategy pursued by the United Arab Emirates in Sudan, and even more so in Yemen, writes columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu, a professor at Sciences Po Paris.

title: EU-Mercosur deal: France's diplomatic gamble falls short
Greenland is and must remain European
The return of the US's predatory imperialism
